snippet.title:
Ignoring The Loop while using Disqus plugin I had to develop a photo-slider in an existing Wordpress template recently. The photo-slider worked for 81% fine. The other 19% was taken by irritation caused by some javascript generated lines of code that constantly showed up in the last slider-slide. Problem When Disqus plugin is active in a Wordpress site it adds automatically javascript lines(See picture) inside Wordpress 'The Loop' Interaction & technique The photoslider shows a photo and some stripped content. If you click on a photo in the slider you'll entering a full text post. The photoslider is a list of posts outputted in html. It uses jquery and cycle which makes transitions and interaction possible.(Example: www.edak.nl) Solution: The wrong way:
In the above example the photo-slider is putted inside the loop. Disqus adds automatically a javascript behavior to every Wordpress 'The Loop'. A few lines of javascript appears in the last slider-slide The wright way: ignoring disquss javascript sjizzles.
Prev Next
5, 'category' => 7 ); $posts = get_posts( $args ); foreach( $posts as $post ) : setup_postdata($post); ?>
In the above example I've putted the post in a 'traditional' PHP foreach LOOP. Everything is now working fine. Ignoring the Loop...sometimes. I hope you found this post helpful!﻿ Meer lezen (71 regels)Minder weergeven  ·  Vertalen

Further progress! (Note to self: get some personal photos up * grin *.)
Here we see the Powers page of the Character Sheet (about 25% coded). Testing a Multiple Discipline case. The cursor (not shown) is on the Missile weapons talent. The sheet will re-calculate all of the talent/power's properties each time the page is refreshed, cache an html table version of them (and the tool-tip) to the token, and then read them back into the sheet. (This cache->read process seems the fastest.)
On that note, I've had a couple of questions from MapTool users on how exactly I'm coding this up.
MapTool's scripting language allows for some interesting HTML3.2 with only certain CSS1 functionality (based on what the underlying java libraries support). This is then combined with a custom scripting language (MTscript) which has all of your IF(), FOREACH(), etc functions, the ability to manipulate JSON objects, and set and get Properties from Tokens.
If that interests you, start reading the Wiki: http://lmwcs.com/rptools/wiki/Main_Page
And then check out this excellent forum post, [aliasmask] Coding Tidbits: http://forums.rptools.net/viewtopic.php?f=20&t=19856﻿
Meer lezen (22 regels)Minder weergeven

Damit bin ich zufrieden: 21 von 25 (leichten) PHP-/MySQL-Fragen richtig beantwortet :) Und das nach 3 Monaten App-Entwicklung in Objective-C, 1 Monat Testautomatisierung in SenseTalk, Bugfixing in C# und aktuell Solr-Entwicklung in Java EE. Ich kann mir die gerade notwendige for-/foreach-Syntax nie merken, zum Glück gibt's dafür gute IDEs ;) PHP- & MySQL-Quiz von Sitepoint: http://www.sitepoint.com/quiz-phpmysql-book/ via +Veljko Sekelj﻿

New component for #EasyPHP 12.1 : #PHP 5.5.0 beta 3 http://www.easyphp.org/components.php
The PHP development team announces the release of the 3rd beta of PHP 5.5.0. This release fixes some bugs against beta 2. THIS IS A DEVELOPMENT PREVIEW - DO NOT USE IT IN PRODUCTION!
PHP 5.5.0beta3 is shipped with some bug fixes and improvements. Here is an incomplete list: \- Drop support for bison < 2.4 when building PHP from GIT source. \- Fixed bug #54567 (DateTimeZone serialize/unserialize) \- Fixed bug #64555 (foreach no longer copies keys if they are interned) \- Fixed bug #64578 (debug_backtrace in set_error_handler corrupts zend heap)
You can read the full list of changes in the NEWS file contained in the release archive.
For source downloads of PHP 5.5.0beta3 please visit the download page, Windows binaries can be found on windows.php.net/qa/.
Our next beta is expected for April 25th. RC should follow.
Thank you for supporting PHP.﻿

If you want that directories in browser of #IMCE correspond to the #OG (#Organigroup) of the user add :
php: $names = array(); foreach($user->og_groups as $group){array_push($names,$group[title]);}return $names;
in the folder path. #drupal﻿
